sections.heading: Volunteer emergency worker; when termination of employment prohibited.
sections.text: Volunteer emergency worker; when termination of employment prohibited.

sections.heading: Employer's violation; civil action. An employee who is
sections.text:
terminated
in
violation of this
Act may bring a civil action against his or her employer who violated this Act.
The
employee may seek reinstatement to his or her former position, payment of
back wages, reinstatement of fringe benefits, and, where seniority rights are
granted, reinstatement of seniority rights. The employee must commence such an
action within one year
after the date of the employer's violation.

sections.heading: Home rule powers.  A home rule unit may not regulate employment
sections.text:
in
a manner inconsistent with the regulation by the State of employment under this
Act.
This Section is a limitation under subsection (i) of Section 6 of Article VII
of the Illinois
Constitution on the concurrent exercise by home rule units of powers and
functions
exercised by the State.

sections.heading: Applicability. This Act does not apply to any employer that is a municipality with a population of 7,500 or more.
sections.text: Applicability. This Act does not apply to any employer that is a municipality with a population of 7,500 or more.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
